text:
Coenties Slip, from Front (left) to Pearl (right) Street's, showing the "El" structure curving between these points. The photographer is viewing westward towards the Produce Exchange Building (tower atop). Note the steam drawn trains. A view closely related to this may be found on page 128 of King's Handbook of New York, 1893.

Early 1890's

Gift Thru New York Historical Society
title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - Front Street

text:
(1) Coenties Slip, west side, north from, and including Front, to and including Pearl Streets. Note the Second and Third Aves., Elevated turning westward on Front Street. Prominent building shown (with tower), is the Produce Exchange.

About 1900.

W. Gray.

(2) The same, from a different angle, and showing a portion of the opposite side of Coenties Slip. The view shows in the distance, the Elevated turning northward on Pearl Street.

About 1900.

W. Gray.

*ASSUMING STREET TO BE NORTH AND SOUTH*
title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - Front Street

text:
Old fashioned horse-drawn Fire Engine in action, at the northern intersection of Front Street and Coenties Slip. This is a pumping machine run by steam.

About 1905.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Horse-drawn fire engine in action.]

text:
Jeannette Park: A small triangular grassy plot on Coenties Slip between South (foreground) and Front Streets. The Slip extends further; to Pearl Street where the Elevated turns northward.

1924.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - South Street

text:
South Street, north from Coenties Slip. The view shows the Seamen's Church Institute, at the N.W. corner of Coenties Slip, (across Jeanette Park). East River Piers shown, are 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10. Note the indistinct outline of the Brooklyn Bridge, in the background.

About 1925.

New York Edison Co.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE NORTH AND SOUTH
title: Manhattan: South Street - Coenties Slip

text:
Coenties Slip as viewed from South Street and showing there- in the triangular Jeanette Park and the looping "El" structure.

In the background of the earlier view one sees the huge Equitable Trust Co. Building under construction. To the right is the colonnaded New York Cotton Exchange.

The later view shows in addition the new International Telephone Building (left), the Bank of New York and Trust Co. Building (right under construction) and the National City Building.

View 1: Sept. 1927
View 2: July 1928

George L. Balgue
title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - South Street

text:

View 2: July 1928

title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - South Street

text:
(1) Coenties Slip, north side, east from Front (left), to South (right) Streets, showing the Seamen's Church Institute. Also shown (foreground), is a portion of Jeanette Park.

August 20, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a view slightly westward. The 5-story house (to the left of the view), is on the N.W. corner of Front Street, and bears No. 42 Coenties Slip, as well as No. 18 Front Street.

September 20, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing a more inclusive view of the surrounding area.

November 2, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - Front Street

text:
South Street, (left), south from, but not including Jone's Lane, to, but not including Coenties Slip, showing the roofs of houses in that area, as seen from the No. 120 Wall Street Building. Also shown, is Front Street, (seen running from foreground to background), west side, from (No. 100), but not including Jone's Lane, to and including Coenties Slip. In the center of the view can be seen Old Slip, south side, west from and including South (left), to, but not including Pearl (right, not shown) Streets, crossing (left to right), Front and Water Streets.

October 22, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) Coenties Slip, north side, east from and including Front, to and including South Streets. Shown is the Seamen's Institute (25 South Street). October 9, 1935. P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a complete view of Jeanette Park. Also seen is South Street, with Piers Nos. 6, 7 and 8, projecting onto the East River. October 9, 1935. P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, and showing the U.S. Army dirigible "Los Angeles". November 2, 1931. P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE EAST AND WEST

text:

(2) The same, showing a complete view of Jeanette Park. Also seen is South Street, with Piers Nos. 6, 7 and 8, projecting onto the East River. October 9, 1935. P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - Front Street

text:
(1)
Coenties Slip, west side, from Front to South Streets. Elevated shown, is the South Ferry Branch of the Second and Third Aves. Elevated Lines. Note a portion of Jeanette Park, in the foreground.

August 4, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same; from the street level.

August 4, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - Front Street

text:
Jeanette Park; Coenties Slip, between South and Front Streets. This view shows the north side of Coenties Slip, west from South to Pearl Streets. On the extreme right, appears the Seamen's Church Institute.

1936.

W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - South Street

text:
Coenties Slip, northwest from Front to Pearl Streets, showing the "El" curve. In the center background is the massive super structure of the Equitable Trust Company building.

1938-9

Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - Front Street

text:
Coenties Slip, at Front Street, showing the 60 Wall Tower above the "El" curve at this point. This view is northward.

October 1, 1938

George D. Chinn
title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - Front Street
